edu.caltech.nanodb.server.properties

Interface PropertyHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BufferManager.BufferManagerPropertyHandler, PlannerFactory.PlannerFactoryPropertyHandler, StorageManager.StoragePropertyHandler, TransactionManager.TransactionPropertyHandler

    public interface PropertyHandler

    This interface can be implemented by components of the database that want to expose properties that can be viewed or manipulated by the NanoDB client via the SHOW VARIABLES or SET varname = ... SQL commands. The interface allows multiple properties to be handled by a single component by requiring the property name to be specified when getting or setting the property value.

    Components that want to expose one or more properties must implement this interface, and then register the specific properties on the PropertyRegistry by calling PropertyRegistry.registerProperties(edu.caltech.nanodb.server.properties.PropertyHandler, java.lang.String...) during initialization.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object getPropertyValue(String propertyName)
      Retrieves the value of the specified property.
      void setPropertyValue(String propertyName, Object value)
      Sets the value of the specified property.

    • Method Detail

      • getPropertyValue

        Object getPropertyValue(String propertyName)
                 throws UnrecognizedPropertyException
        Retrieves the value of the specified property.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property to retrieve
        Returns:
        the current value of the property
        Throws:
        UnrecognizedPropertyException

      • setPropertyValue

        void setPropertyValue(String propertyName,
                      Object value)
               throws UnrecognizedPropertyException,
                      ReadOnlyPropertyException,
                      TypeCastException
        Sets the value of the specified property.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property to set
        value - the new value to set the property to
        Throws:
        ReadOnlyPropertyException - if the specified property is read-only and cannot be modified.
        TypeCastException - if the specified value is not the correct type for the property, and cannot be coerced into the correct type by the TypeConverter.
        UnrecognizedPropertyException
